data.title: Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom LLP
data.meta_description: Raza Rasheed represents clients in a wide range of complex civil matters in state and federal courts and private arbitrations, with a particular focus on shareholder derivative suits, securities class actions and trade secret misappropriation actions.
data.text:
In recognition of his work, Mr. Rasheed was named one of Best Lawyers’ 2024 Ones To Watch in America.

Among others, he has represented:

Monsanto Company in securing a unanimous defense verdict (reached after three hours of deliberations) following a seven-week jury trial in Cook County, Illinois, against claims brought by four plaintiffs who alleged that they developed non-Hodgkin lymphoma after being exposed to Monsanto’s Roundup weed killer and fire-retardant additives known as polychlorinated biphenyls (PCBs) made by the company

Baidu, Inc. and two of its senior officers in securing the dismissal of a federal securities class action alleging that the company had misrepresented its ability to comply with Chinese internet content regulations in a series of 12 public statements spanning more than a year. This case was recognized by the Daily Journal as one of the Top Verdicts of 2021 in California

a major shared workspace company in securing a stay of a pair of shareholder derivative lawsuits against the company’s directors, officers and investors

a clinical trials company in obtaining a stay of a derivative lawsuit brought by the company’s founders, followed by a favorable settlement

a leading health insurance company in obtaining dismissal with prejudice of derivative claims brought against the company’s senior leadership team

a major Chinese e-commerce operator in defending against federal securities claims brought in California state court

the CEO of a Fortune 500 company in litigation brought by a former business associate

a major roofing materials manufacturer in trade secret litigation brought by a competitor

foreign investors in a California-based cannabis growing business in obtaining a favorable settlement of employment litigation with the business’s former CEO

a cryptocurrency developer in obtaining a favorable settlement of a securities arbitration brought by an investor

Mr. Rasheed was a participant in the Leadership Council on Legal Diversity’s 2023 Pathfinders Program, a seven-month leadership and professional development initiative.
